snippet: Sonoma State University has announced details about the opening of its new music hall, including a partnership with the San Francisco Symphony.
abstract: Sonoma State University has announced details about the opening of its new music hall, including a partnership with the San Francisco Symphony.
lead_paragraph: When the financier Sanford I. Weill wanted a sense of what the music hall being built at Sonoma State University would sound like, he asked a friend, the pianist Lang Lang, to stop by to play. Mr. Weill liked what he heard, so he and his wife, Joan, went on to donate $12 million toward the project's $130 million cost.

headline.main: Lang Lang to Play at Sonoma State Opening
